details.publicNotes:
Rift dragons are drawn to, and some suggest born from, elemental imbalances. Anywhere the elemental planes clash and cross with the prime material a rift dragon may appear, and will act to defend it from interference. They have a strong resistance to the direct touch of the divine, and to the forged metal of civilization, as if made to counter sentience itself.

Left to their own devices, they will attempt to become rulers of any given location of planar interference, drawing on the power of the friction generated between two competing planes of reality. They fiercely defend such places and will attack foolhardy adventurers or soldiers who attempt to dispel such dangerous places.Â 

Approached carefully, and making no attempt to harm their home, rift dragons can be spoken with and even enjoy a good conversation. Not inherently evil, they can be reasoned with, but they are as mercurial as the disturbances they call home.

description.value:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical. You or anyone you advise about the aura gains a +2 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on the item. If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's rank is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.
The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

The dragon wreathes itself in visible manifestations of an element. It can choose from fire, cold, lightning, acid, positive, or negative. It gains resistance 10 against that element. Those ending their turn within 5 feet of the dragon take 10 points of that element damage. This remains until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Effects and spells with the mental trait operate against the dragon one category in the dragon's disadvantage (turning a hit to a critical success or a failed saving throw into a critical failure, as examples).
The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

The dragon breathes a blast of elemental fury that matches the element of the plane or rift it is currently in. This deals @Damage[14d6[@actor.flags.pf2e.riftDragon.element]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds} or if it's not in an elementally aligned area. Positive and negative are valid elements, but will never heal a creature (but could fail to damage it).

The dragon creates an imbalance where there was none before. The area (100 yard burst from the dragon) gains a shift of fire, cold, acid, electricity, positive, or negative. This ability gains the trait of the chosen element. Effects that deal this damage do 1 more damage per die. Effects that deal the opposite deal 1 less per die of damage. This can only be used in places without elemental favor to begin with. This does allow the rift dragon to use its elemental abilities. It lasts for 1 minute and cannot be used again for one day.
